meanings.definition: Any of two or more functionally similar proteins that have a similar but not identical amino acid sequence.
meanings.sent1: Scientists studied the isoform to understand its role in the body.
meanings.sent2: The isoform plays a crucial part in the cell's functions.
meanings.sent3: The isoform walked into a party full of identical twins, feeling like the odd one out.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity was an isoform of her mother's artistic talent.
meanings.sent5: The isoform stood out in the crowd with its unique characteristics.

meanings.definition: A variant of a protein that is produced from the same gene by alternative splicing or post-translational modification.
meanings.sent1: The isoform exhibited different properties compared to the original protein.
meanings.sent2: Researchers identified a new isoform during their experiment.
meanings.sent3: The isoform decided to try a new hairstyle, surprising its gene siblings.
meanings.sent4: His sense of humor was an isoform that brought joy to everyone around him.
meanings.sent5: The isoform's presence altered the dynamics of the protein family.
